result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner R. Emond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *AODA and any follow-up treatment.  *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *No contact with Theresa Emond unless agent approval.  *Granted 84 days credit if revoked.  *Defendant may be released from jail today.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tanner R. Emond in court with attorney Alicia M. Nall.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Nall agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has an open case in Columbia County also.
Atty Nall makes sentencing statements and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
No contact with Theresa Emond unless agent approval
Credit = 84 days (if revoked)
Defendant may be released

Return date on May 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
**Motion for Bail Modification to be heard at the same time**
Return date on May 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tanner R. Emond in court with attorney Alicia M. Nall.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Atty Nall states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Nall enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.

Atty Nall argues bond amount.  Atty Nall states that the defendant would be living with his mother in Baraboo.
Atty Hendee responds and asks that bond remain as is.
BY THE COURT:   Court denies the defendant's request; Bond will continue as is.  Return date scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
*No contact with Theresa Emond or her residence at 615 Market St., Lot 2, Westfield.

Defendant Tanner R. Emond in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was taken in on a warrant from December.  In the meantime, the defendant was taken into custody on a Sauk County warrant in January where a cash bond was set in that matter.
Court states that the PD office appointed Atty Nall on the case; his JA has tried to contact her several times.  Court questions the defendant regarding the address.  Defendant states that he is looking for a place to live; he no longer lives at that address.  
Court is not going to conduct an Initial Appearance due to the Attorney not appearing today.  Defendant states that he did not know about the court date in December.

Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions:

Defendant asks if he could get a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Theresa Emond or her residence at 615 Market St., Lot 2, Westfield.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tanner R. Emond not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
